column4: how to i download the repositories into my local hard drive so that i can distribute it to my friends through LAN..??
yeah.. but still i have a fast interenet connection @ home, my frenz dont have it... so i need to download them..

there is a program in synaptic that will allow you to create a repository on a cd, but I've forgotten the name.  You'll have problems downloading all the things in the repos. it's thousands of packages.
cant i download them to an external hard disk??
sure you can.. but you want ALL of the packages?
no not all.. but how to i find specific repos alone.??
I think what asking is how to find the repos and download what you want directly right? if so you can do that via the command line using apt
nope.. im not askin abt downloadin and installin them in mine.. im asking about downloading and givin it to my frenz thru lan.. coz my frenz dont have direct internet access..
I understand.. apt will still download without installing them on your machine. You'll then be able to copy the .deb files to the external hd
oh is that so?? can u plz explain step by step.. coz am a very much newbie..
I'm not great with apt at the command line.. open a terminal and type man apt.. there's more info there. you can also try info apt
thanks a lot :)
np..
check out man apt-get for info.. man apt doesn't have anything.
yup.. am chekin out ..
as for your calculator.. did you know the one with ubuntu has a mode selection from basic to financial and scientific?
ya i do.. i still wanna add some more to it..
I think it's gcalctool  http://calctool.sourceforge.net/
ya ok ill see..
you should be able to get the source from thee.
i got the source..ty
np
